website_summaries.verdict: The $150 Kitchenaid Precision Press features a built-in scale to measure coffee grounds and water but its high price doesn't translate into extra convenience.
pros: The KitchenAid Precision Press comes equipped with a scale to weigh coffee grounds and hot water
The Precision Press also features a timer to track brew time and a stainless-steel carafe to retain heat longer than glass containers
cons: For $50 more than even premium steel French press coffee brews, the Kitchenaid Precision Press is expensive
If you're not fast enough, the Precision Press' scale times out and resets to zero
The coffee maker can't heat water on its own

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Really nice but heavy to handle, I am a strong man and I can feel it is heavy specially when it is full, and cleaning it is not easy, I am not talking about the electronic handle or the battery base, I am talking about the press shaft and the pressers itself , it has so many edges and corners you have to use a tooth brush to remove the coffee grains, and let us face it to open the shaft and clean it dismantled is not a practical solution. Not a deal breaker for me but something to conceder if you are not welling to do all of this.
customer_reviews.author: Al.

customer_reviews.title: Works good, but I think it is overprice.
customer_reviews.text: This is working fine. Makes good coffee, but when it had around a month it ran out of battery, I thought it got damage, but fortunately it was just the battery. I like the product but I think it is a bit overprice that's why I am not giving the 5 starts.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel G

customer_reviews.title: I’m in love with it
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a birthday gift from my husband and now it’s the only way I make my coffee!! I’m in love with it!
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Mine works perfectly fine. I appreciate the insulation
customer_reviews.text: Mine works perfectly fine. I appreciate the insulation. Coffee is smoother brewed this way. I put the used grounds in the garden. It is a bit pricey but my kitchen is all Kitchen aid appliances so I didn't mind paying the high price.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Black.

customer_reviews.title: Best Press ever!
customer_reviews.text: Super amazing French Press!!! The scale & timer are a MUST!!
customer_reviews.author: Lindseysue

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is the best French press period. it operates very smoothly and sealing is perfect with double o-rigns and vaccum seal. the timer should have been a count down timer with a beeper but that's ok. high quality stainless steel and accurate electronic scale. perfect gift for coffee lovers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Makes a good cup of coffee, the scale is sensitive and took a minute to figure out but solid overall, replaced previous glass french press and was worth the switch
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D

customer_reviews.title: Says it is electric. Not. Battery timer. ...
customer_reviews.text: Says it is electric. Not. Battery timer. Still need to boil water on stove.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L. Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: So I suppose I'm going through a midlife crisis and despite having never had any interest in coffee whatsoever, I decided to do so in order to help kick a nasty energy drink habit. I knew I wanted a French press - maybe it's a Dexter thing. Maybe I just wanted to be different. My parents - lifetime coffee drinkers - are much more mainstream. Growing up it was a programmable automatic drip coffee maker and more recently a Keurig machine for the ultimate in convenience. Despite my incredibly busy lifestyle and a propensity towards tardiness
customer_reviews.author: Justin T

customer_reviews.title: More junk from KitchenAid
customer_reviews.text: KitchenAid has only one great product, and they sell lots of crap with their name. You'd think that this French Press was insulated, you'd think the cool electronics would be helpful. Not even a 'beep' on the timer. lame
customer_reviews.author: Omnimark

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, but expensive french press.
customer_reviews.text: This French Press is a stepup from my Bodom glass french press. However, it also costs about three times as much. It's a beautiful looking object and the timer and scale are reasonably easy to use. I wouldn't call either essential though, so if you're interested in trying french press coffee, I would start with a more basic french press.
customer_reviews.author: choiceweb0pen0

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I think this is such a great product, I love that Kitchenaid keeps introducing new appliances. I highly recommend this to everyone who loves coffee
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: I thought I would like the additional features and benefits
customer_reviews.text: Over complicates manual brew coffee! I thought I would like the additional features and benefits, but cannot put it in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Lover 16

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KCM0512SS Precision Press Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: The KitchenAid Precision Press Coffee Maker combines a classic French Press enhanced with integrated scale and timer to precisely create a bold, full bodied brew.
feature_bullets: Dual Wall, Stainless Steel Construction,Kindly refer the user guide under product description for cleaning instructions
Soft Grip Handle is comfortable and easy to use
Sleek Profile: Streamlined design reduces countertop clutter

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars35 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
